Class FButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent

    public abstract class FButton
extends FComponent
    Represents a button.

    uli

      • hide

        public void hide(boolean flag)
        Description copied from class: FComponent
        Hides the element by assigning/removing the 'hidden' class name, then populates its state.

        To simply set a component to hidden, without also triggering a FComponent.populateView() (for example during rendering), see FComponent.setHidden(boolean)
        Overrides:
        hide in class FComponent
        Parameters:
        flag - if true hides if false displays

      • setHidden

        Overrides:
        setHidden in class FComponent
        Parameters:

        onclick javascript action

      • overwriteOnclick

        public void overwriteOnclick(java.lang.String onclick)
        overwrites the onclick action note: catchEvent(Id) --> from ajax.js should be called in order to execute the serverside onclick event and to be able to use onClick method
        Parameters:
        onclick - javascript String

      • setInstantOnClick

        public void setInstantOnClick(java.lang.String instantOnClick)
        Use this in case you want to add extra javascript function calls to the onClick event, aside from the catchEventId(). Useful when you need the button to immediately react to a click, and not wait for an FClientUpdate. Has no effect if overwriteOnclick(String) is used.
        Parameters:
        instantOnClick -

      • setConfirmationQuestion

        public void setConfirmationQuestion(java.lang.String question)
        Sets the question to be asked on button click. An ajax popup comes up with 2 buttons, Ok and Cancel. If Ok is pressed, the onClick() is called, otherwise no action is performed.

        Note: Uses setInstantOnClick(String), so these two methods should not be called on the same FButton, as they conflict.
